messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Famous homeschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you!  This was just what I had in mind, but not in hand.  Now I do. Thank you so much!  HeidiC.
messages.messageBody:
Thank you! This was just what I had in mind, but not in hand. Now I
do. Thank you so much! HeidiC.

>The website I got them from has a MUCH longer list of famous homeschoolers,

>Maybe you could print the list and a couple biographies of some of these

>And make sure you send her Sandra's page. She's famous in the unschooling

messages.subject: Famous homeschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/22/03 4:44:31 AM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/22/03 4:44:31 AM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< She respects someone's thoughts more if they are
famous. >>

Well maybe a list like this will impress her. These people were either
homeschooled or self taught for a large portion (if not all) of their lives.
The website I got them from has a MUCH longer list of famous homeschoolers,
but be forewarned, it is a Christian homeschooling site.
Maybe you could print the list and a couple biographies of some of these
folks. THAT should impress her.
http://www.christianhomeschoolers.com/hs/famous.shtml

And make sure you send her Sandra's page. She's famous in the unschooling
world.:)

ARTISTS:
Leonardo da Vinci
Claude Monet
John Singleton Copley
Andrew Wyeth
Jamie Wyeth
COMPOSERS:
Irving Berlin
Anton Bruckner
Felix Mendelssohn
Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
Francis Poulenc
EDUCATORS:
Fred Terman (Stanford University President)
William Samuel Johnson (Columbia University President)
Frank Vandiver (Texas A&M University President)
John Witherspoon (Princeton University President)
GENERALS:
Stonewall Jackson
Robert E. Lee
Douglas Mac Arthur
George Patton
INVENTORS:
Alexander Graham Bell
Thomas Edison
Cyrus McCormick
Orville Wright
Wilbur Wright
PRESIDENTS:
John Quincy Adams
William Henry Harrison
Thomas Jefferson
Abraham Lincoln
James Madison
Franklin Delano Roosevelt
Theodore Roosevelt
John Tyler
George Washington
Woodrow Wilson
PREACHERS & RELIGIOUS LEADERS:
Moses
Joan of Arc
John the Baptist
William Cary
Jonathan Edwards
Phillip Melanchthon
Dwight L. Moody
John Newton
John Owen
Charles Wesley
John Wesley
Brigham Young
SCIENTISTS:
George Washington Carver
Pierre Curie
Albert Einstein
Blaise Pascal
Booker T. Washington
